definition[0]: a type of detergent for washing clothes, sold in the US
definition[1]: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement
example[0]: A great cheer went up from the crowd.
example[1]: So let’s give a cheer to the kids who passed their exams.
example[2]: The final whistle was greeted with triumphant cheers from players and spectators.
definition[2]: a feeling of happiness and confidence
example[3]: ‘Hello, ’ said Auguste cheerily. His good cheer was not returned.
definition[3]: a special chant (=phrase that is repeated) that the crowds at a US sports game shout in order to encourage their team to win
definition[4]: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something
example[5]: Everybody cheered when the firemen arrived.
example[6]: The audience was shouting and cheering.
definition[5]: to make someone feel more hopeful when they are worried
example[8]: By late afternoon there came news that cheered them all.
example[9]: Government policy towards higher education contains little to cheer university students.
